channel.title: Magor
channel.description:
[img]http://i.imgur.com/P6QwVLy.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/9tGFPyK.png[/img]
I don't know why I'm still here at mscp, I can't remember the last time I saw somebody giving a positive comment on somebody's work, half of the few people left here are arrogant douchbags.
Anyways I've been here for many years now, climbing up from changing npc-spawns up to writing frameworks. I had been struggling with keeping motivation for projects but eventually I found the motivation back with Magor. I wanted to write a decent base that looks a bit "different" from what people are used but still stable and ready for adding content.
I nearly reached it apart from a few bugs and some content I still planned. But I cant be bothered continuing since there is zero support for what you do in this community if it isn't a 700+ or if you're name isn't popular.
I'm releasing this project in case there will be a day somebody is interested in my project.
[url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,668099.0.html]Click here for the development thread.[/url]
[url=http://up.ht/1BEy0nC]Click here to download[/url] [url=http://www.mediafire.com/download/8tz68m8xwb92v7v/Magor_netty.rar]Or here[/url]
[i]If you're looking for a client, I used Galkon's refactored 478 look-a-like for the development.[/i]

item.title: Magor
item.dc:creator: @Stunninhigh Stunninhigh
item.description:
@Stunninhigh wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:5, topic:549521”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=668420.msg4470379#msg4470379 date=1422646177]I can’t remember the last time I saw somebody
giving a positive comment on somebody’s work, half of the few people left here are arrogant douchbags.
[/quote]
YES! Thank you! This is exactly how moparscape is now

I wouldn’t have given the idiots here a source, even if the code was horrible or not[/quote]

Truth

Read full topic

item.title: Magor
item.dc:creator: @jummppy jummppy
item.description:
@jummppy wrote:

Extremely sad to not see you make this go even farther. But always a good job. This base is really promising. I hope someone will put this base to good use. I may just take a copy and start adding content to it. Then release it for people to use it.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Well thanks for the contribution nonetheless, I wish for the best and the development of this looks like it went along nicely. Good job and thanks for the release of it.

Read full topic

item.title: Magor
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

I don’t know why I’m still here at mscp, I can’t remember the last time I saw somebody
giving a positive comment on somebody’s work, half of the few people left here are arrogant douchbags.

Anyways I’ve been here for many years now, climbing up from changing npc-spawns up to writing frameworks.
I had been struggling with keeping motivation for projects but eventually I found the motivation back with Magor.
I wanted to write a decent base that looks a bit “different” from what people are used but still stable and
ready for adding content.

I nearly reached it apart from a few bugs and some content I still planned.
But I cant be bothered continuing since there is zero support for what you do in this community if it isn’t a 700+ or if you’re name isn’t popular.

I’m releasing this project in case there will be a day somebody is interested in my project.

Click here for the development thread.
